page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY (1940's) -blackout curtains and a German plane saw the light and dropped a bomb.There was also two bomb holes out by Hartsgarth farm on the Hermitage road.There were four{churches}in the {1940's}Castleton,St john village hall and the south church at the bottom of the village.Mr Wilson first heard about world war 2 on the radio. There was an unidentified plane which turned out to be friendly over London Mr wilson lived in{Newcastleton}from 1930 to 1956 and then moved, for 14 years and then moved back.Mr Robson lived in the village since 1930 and has never moved. We worked out from Mr. Wilson's date of birth(1922) that he was 63 years old.
